Horizontal pod autoscaling is a [beta](../../../docs/api.md#api-versioning) feature in Kubernetes 1.1.
It allows the number of pods in a replication controller or deployment to scale automatically based on observed CPU usage.
In the future also other metrics will be supported.

comments.body: First increase the load current cpu is 305%,  increase the load again, why cpu low to 65%?

Because of the increased number of replicas.
1 replica 305% -> 7 replicas ~45% (don't remember exact stat) -> increase load -> 10 replicas 65% (this is above the target, but we are capped by max replicas = 10)
